content: Hello all, I am testing Zulip for a specific type of operational use. I am very happy with everything Zulip has on offer - while remaining very easy to use! The only thing I can't figure out is wether it is possible to do away with the "users"-menu in the (upper) right corner of the screen, i.e. I don't want users to view all the other users. Does anyone know if it is possible to remover the "users"-menu?
@Arvid Fens can you talk more specifically about what you're trying to achieve?
One can hide the menu, but at an API level the data showed there is important to rendering messages (E.g. one needs to know the name and user ID for a given user).
So depending whether this is a security or clutter consideration will determine whether you can actually achieve your goals with a small change to disable the right sidebar.
